comments.body:
Can we get some documentation on how this works?

Also if this is the only public method in the file, does it make more sense as the first method?
the documentation is now significantly longer than the implementation.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +171,175 @@# For a complete example, consult something like the release-tars target in
# build/release-tars/BUILD.
def for_platforms(
        for_client = None,
        for_node = None,

comments.body:
The main thing I do not understand is how `select()` works, which this doesn't actually answer and probably no one aside from you has used before.

Most of the rest is just python, which there is a lot more familiarity about in the community.

IMO a link to bazel's select docs would be helpful: https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/functions.html#select

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +130,134 @@                    d[constraint] = value.format(**fmt_args)

# for_platforms returns a dictionary to be used with select().
# select() is used for configurable attributes (most attributes, notably
# excluding output filenames), and takes a dictionary mapping a condition
